answers.answer: It could be because of a lot of things. No one ever measures right to the day. Your baby might be bigger than normal might not be. 6 weeks is a big jump ahead. Just don't stress and ask your doctor why.

You could have extra amniotic fluid. Or your due date can be off. Either way you'll find out soon. I have measured ahead as well I have just a lil extra fluid and baby was in 55 percentile at 34 weeks weighing 6lbs 9oz.
Not to stress & worry is easier said than done but I'm trying!
What does it mean when you have extra fluid?

It can be a number of things. My Dr said my baby measures a month ahead. At 28 weeks I found out that I had gestational diabetes, making the baby bigger in size and ahead of schedule.  Yes it's easier said than done, but don't stress is not good for you or baby! I'm 40 weeks today. I have a scheduled c-section on Wednesday because he's expected to weigh over 9lbs, with broad shoulders due to the GD.
I was measuring 4 weeks ahead.  We got a scan and she was only about a week so there was no worries and my date did not changed.  Sometimes they just have a growth spurt.
So you had to have a c section because he was a 9 pound baby? Thanks nbssey I hope it turns out that way. I haven't been tested for GD yet I'll get tested July 22.
Excuse me have to have a c section...not had.

question: I go for a growth ultrasound tomorrow bc I'measuring right at 6 weeks ahead as of last week. I'm 25 weeks & 2 days today.  My husband was a big baby could that be why? Please give me some advice!
title: Feeling nervous and nobody is answering my question!
